intro: Hieracium hemipsilum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium hemipsilum is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed habitats and can sometimes become invasive in non-native regions.
